intro: Schultesianthus dudleyi, commonly known as Dudley's schultesianthus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
